verses.esv: 8 But if anyone does not provide for his relatives, and especially for members of his household, he has denied the faith and is worse than an unbeliever.
verses.kjv: 8 But if any provide not for his own, and specially for those of his own house, he hath denied the faith, and is worse than an infidel.
verses.niv: 8 If anyone does not provide for his relatives, and especially for his immediate family, he has denied the faith and is worse than an unbeliever.

verses.esv: 5:1 Do not rebuke an older man but encourage him as you would a father, younger men as brothers,
verses.kjv: 1 Rebuke not an elder, but intreat him as a father; and the younger men as brethren;
verses.niv: 1 Do not rebuke an older man harshly, but exhort him as if he were your father. Treat younger men as brothers,

verses.esv: 35 In all things I have shown you that by working hard in this way we must help the weak and remember the words of the Lord Jesus, how he himself said, ‘It is more blessed to give than to receive.’”
verses.kjv: 35 I have shewed you all things, how that so labouring ye ought to support the weak, and to remember the words of the Lord Jesus, how he said, It is more blessed to give than to receive.
verses.niv: 35 In everything I did, I showed you that by this kind of hard work we must help the weak, remembering the words the Lord Jesus himself said: 'It is more blessed to give than to receive.'"

verses.esv: 32 “You shall stand up before the gray head and honor the face of an old man, and you shall fear your God: I am the LORD.
verses.kjv: 32 Thou shalt rise up before the hoary head, and honour the face of the old man, and fear thy God: I am the LORD.
verses.niv: 32 "'Rise in the presence of the aged, show respect for the elderly and revere your God. I am the LORD.

verses.esv:
9   Do not cast me off in the time of old age;
    forsake me not when my strength is spent.
verses.kjv: 9 Cast me not off in the time of old age; forsake me not when my strength faileth.
verses.niv: 9 Do not cast me away when I am old; do not forsake me when my strength is gone.

verses.esv: 4 But if a widow has children or grandchildren, let them first learn to show godliness to their own household and to make some return to their parents, for this is pleasing in the sight of God.
verses.kjv: 4 But if any widow have children or nephews, let them learn first to shew piety at home, and to requite their parents: for that is good and acceptable before God.
verses.niv: 4 But if a widow has children or grandchildren, these should learn first of all to put their religion into practice by caring for their own family and so repaying their parents and grandparents, for this is pleasing to God.

verses.esv: 27 Religion that is pure and undefiled before God the Father is this: to visit orphans and widows in their affliction, and to keep oneself unstained from the world.
verses.kjv: 27 Pure religion and undefiled before God and the Father is this, To visit the fatherless and widows in their affliction, and to keep himself unspotted from the world.
verses.niv: 27 Religion that God our Father accepts as pure and faultless is this: to look after orphans and widows in their distress and to keep oneself from being polluted by the world.

verses.esv: 2 “Honor your father and mother” (this is the first commandment with a promise),
verses.kjv: 2 Honour thy father and mother; (which is the first commandment with promise;)
verses.niv: 2 "Honor your father and mother"--which is the first commandment with a promise--

verses.esv:
4   even to your old age I am he,
    and to gray hairs I will carry you.
  I have made, and I will bear;
    I will carry and will save.
verses.kjv: 4 And even to your old age I am he; and even to hoar hairs will I carry you: I have made, and I will bear; even I will carry, and will deliver you.
verses.niv: 4 Even to your old age and gray hairs I am he, I am he who will sustain you. I have made you and I will carry you; I will sustain you and I will rescue you.

verses.esv: 12 “Honor your father and your mother, that your days may be long in the land that the LORD your God is giving you.
verses.kjv: 12 Honour thy father and thy mother: that thy days may be long upon the land which the LORD thy God giveth thee.
verses.niv: 12 "Honor your father and your mother, so that you may live long in the land the LORD your God is giving you.

verses.esv:
31   Gray hair is a crown of glory;
    it is gained in a righteous life.
verses.kjv: 31 The hoary head is a crown of glory, if it be found in the way of righteousness.
verses.niv: 31 Gray hair is a crown of splendor; it is attained by a righteous life.

verses.esv: 17 Let the elders who rule well be considered worthy of double honor, especially those who labor in preaching and teaching.
verses.kjv: 17 Let the elders that rule well be counted worthy of double honour, especially they who labour in the word and doctrine.
verses.niv: 17 The elders who direct the affairs of the church well are worthy of double honor, especially those whose work is preaching and teaching.

verses.esv: 3 Honor widows who are truly widows. 4 But if a widow has children or grandchildren, let them first learn to show godliness to their own household and to make some return to their parents, for this is pleasing in the sight of God.
verses.kjv: 3 Honour widows that are widows indeed. 4 But if any widow have children or nephews, let them learn first to shew piety at home, and to requite their parents: for that is good and acceptable before God.
verses.niv: 3 Give proper recognition to those widows who are really in need. 4 But if a widow has children or grandchildren, these should learn first of all to put their religion into practice by caring for their own family and so repaying their parents and grandparents, for this is pleasing to God.

verses.esv: 4 For God commanded, ‘Honor your father and your mother,’ and, ‘Whoever reviles father or mother must surely die.’ 5 But you say, ‘If anyone tells his father or his mother, “What you would have gained from me is given to God,” 6 he need not honor his father.’ So for the sake of your tradition you have made void the word of God.
verses.kjv: 4 For God commanded, saying, Honour thy father and mother: and, He that curseth father or mother, let him die the death. 5 But ye say, Whosoever shall say to his father or his mother, It is a gift, by whatsoever thou mightest be profited by me; 6 And honour not his father or his mother, he shall be free. Thus have ye made the commandment of God of none effect by your tradition.
verses.niv: 4 For God said, 'Honor your father and mother' and 'Anyone who curses his father or mother must be put to death.' 5 But you say that if a man says to his father or mother, 'Whatever help you might otherwise have received from me is a gift devoted to God,' 6 he is not to 'honor his father 'with it. Thus you nullify the word of God for the sake of your tradition.

verses.esv: 16 If any believing woman has relatives who are widows, let her care for them. Let the church not be burdened, so that it may care for those who are truly widows.
verses.kjv: 16 If any man or woman that believeth have widows, let them relieve them, and let not the church be charged; that it may relieve them that are widows indeed.
verses.niv: 16 If any woman who is a believer has widows in her family, she should help them and not let the church be burdened with them, so that the church can help those widows who are really in need.

verses.esv:
22   Listen to your father who gave you life,
    and do not despise your mother when she is old.
verses.kjv: 22 Hearken unto thy father that begat thee, and despise not thy mother when she is old.
verses.niv: 22 Listen to your father, who gave you life, and do not despise your mother when she is old.

verses.esv: 16 Do not neglect to do good and to share what you have, for such sacrifices are pleasing to God.
verses.kjv: 16 But to do good and to communicate forget not: for with such sacrifices God is well pleased.
verses.niv: 16 And do not forget to do good and to share with others, for with such sacrifices God is pleased.

verses.esv: 5:1 Do not rebuke an older man but encourage him as you would a father, younger men as brothers, 2 older women as mothers, younger women as sisters, in all purity.
verses.kjv: 1 Rebuke not an elder, but intreat him as a father; and the younger men as brethren; 2 The elder women as mothers; the younger as sisters, with all purity.
verses.niv: 1 Do not rebuke an older man harshly, but exhort him as if he were your father. Treat younger men as brothers, 2 older women as mothers, and younger women as sisters, with absolute purity.

verses.esv: 5 Likewise, you who are younger, be subject to the elders. Clothe yourselves, all of you, with humility toward one another, for “God opposes the proud but gives grace to the humble.”
verses.kjv: 5 Likewise, ye younger, submit yourselves unto the elder. Yea, all of you be subject one to another, and be clothed with humility: for God resisteth the proud, and giveth grace to the humble.
verses.niv: 5 Young men, in the same way be submissive to those who are older. All of you, clothe yourselves with humility toward one another, because, "God opposes the proud but gives grace to the humble."

verses.kjv: 12 With the ancient is wisdom; and in length of days understanding.
verses.niv: 12 Is not wisdom found among the aged? Does not long life bring understanding?

verses.kjv: 3 Honour widows that are widows indeed.

verses.niv: 29 The glory of young men is their strength, gray hair the splendor of the old.
